intro: Guapeba stilosa, commonly known as the Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and along riverbanks. Guapeba stilosa is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display.
